p: Another compound isolated from T. versicolor is a polysaccharide peptide (PSP). PSP contains rhamnose and arabinose, two monosaccharides not found in PSK. In addition, the conjugated protein was also different. PSP has been commercially available in the Chinese market since 1987 [ 21]. It has been documented to improve the quality of life in cancer patients by providing substantial pain relief and enhancing immune status in 70â€“97% of patients with stomach, esophagus, lung, ovary and cervical cancers. Specifically, PSP has been shown to be capable of boosting immune cell production, ameliorating chemotherapy symptoms, and enhancing tumor infiltration by dendritic and cytotoxic T-cells [ 26].
